name: High-Intensity Interval Training (HIIT)
description: High-intensity bodyweight cardio exercises. Maximum calorie burn, minimal time. NOT for low-energy days.

exercises.name: Burpee
exercises.description: Full-body high-intensity movement. The ultimate conditioning exercise. Very challenging.
instructions: Stand with feet shoulder-width apart
Squat down and place hands on floor
Jump or step feet back to plank position
Perform push-up (optional for easier version)
Jump or step feet forward to hands
Explode up into jump with arms overhead
Land softly and immediately go into next rep

modifications.easier: Step back instead of jump, skip push-up, step up instead of jump
modifications.harder: Add tuck jump at top, add extra push-up, increase speed

conditions.wrist: Lots of wrist loading - may need to avoid
conditions.energy_low: DO NOT do this on low-energy days

exercises.name: Mountain Climbers
exercises.description: High-intensity cardio and core combo. Builds endurance and core strength simultaneously.
instructions: Start in push-up position, hands under shoulders
Keep core tight and body in straight line
Drive one knee towards chest
Quickly switch legs, driving other knee forward
Keep hips low - don't let them pike up
Move as fast as you can while maintaining form
Keep hands firmly planted throughout

modifications.easier: Slow pace, step instead of jump, hands elevated on bench
modifications.harder: Cross knee to opposite elbow, increase speed, add push-up between reps

conditions.wrist: Lots of wrist loading - consider elevated surface
conditions.shoulder: Sustained plank position - may need to modify
conditions.hip: High hip flexor demand - may aggravate hip issues

exercises.name: Jumping Jacks
exercises.description: Classic cardio warm-up. Elevates heart rate, warms whole body. Simple, effective.
instructions: Stand tall with feet together, arms at sides
Jump feet out wide while raising arms overhead
Body forms star shape at top
Jump feet back together while lowering arms
Keep steady rhythm throughout
Land softly on balls of feet
Breathe rhythmically - don't hold breath

modifications.easier: Step side to side instead of jumping (step jacks)
modifications.harder: Add squat between each jack, increase speed, add clap overhead

conditions.knee: Impact may aggravate - use step jacks
conditions.shoulder: Overhead arm motion may bother shoulders

exercises.name: High Knees
exercises.description: Cardio and hip flexor engagement. Great warm-up or cardio burst. Running in place with attitude.
instructions: Stand tall with feet hip-width apart
Run in place, driving knees up towards chest
Aim to get knees to hip height or higher
Pump arms in running motion
Stay on balls of feet
Keep core engaged and posture tall
Maintain quick tempo - like sprinting in place

modifications.easier: March instead of run, lower knee height, slower pace
modifications.harder: Increase speed, knee to chest height, add arm drivers overhead

conditions.hip: Intense hip flexor work - may be problematic
conditions.ankle: Lots of impact on balls of feet

exercises.name: Jump Rope
exercises.description: High-intensity cardio. Great calorie burn. Improves coordination. Short duration, high impact.
instructions: Hold rope handles at hip height
Use wrists to spin rope, not whole arms
Jump just high enough to clear rope (1 inch)
Land softly on balls of feet
Keep elbows close to body
Maintain steady rhythm - don't rush
Breathe rhythmically throughout

modifications.easier: Single bounce (two feet), slower pace, more rest breaks
modifications.harder: Double unders, single leg hops, increase duration, criss-cross

conditions.knee: High impact - may need to skip
conditions.ankle: Lots of ankle stress - use cautiously
conditions.calf: Can cause calf tightness or strain

exercises.name: Squat Jumps
exercises.description: Explosive lower body power. Builds leg strength and cardiovascular fitness. Very intense.
instructions: Stand with feet shoulder-width apart
Squat down until thighs parallel to floor
Explode up into jump as high as possible
Swing arms overhead to help drive jump
Land softly with knees bent, absorbing impact
Immediately go into next squat
Focus on soft landings to protect knees

modifications.easier: Bodyweight squats (no jump), smaller jump height, more rest between reps
modifications.harder: Tuck knees to chest mid-air, increase height, continuous reps no pause

exercises.name: Butt Kicks
exercises.description: Running drill and cardio exercise. Hamstring engagement, dynamic warm-up or high-intensity work.
instructions: Stand tall, feet hip-width apart
Run in place, kicking heels up towards butt
Try to touch butt with heels each rep
Keep thighs perpendicular to ground
Pump arms in running motion
Stay light on balls of feet
Maintain quick tempo

modifications.easier: Slower pace, don't kick as high, march instead of run
modifications.harder: Increase speed, kick higher, move forward while kicking

conditions.hamstring: Active hamstring flexion - may aggravate recent injury
conditions.calf: High calf demand staying on toes

exercises.name: Skater Jumps
exercises.description: Lateral plyometric movement. Builds power, balance, coordination. Skating motion.
instructions: Stand on right leg, left leg behind right
Jump laterally to left, landing on left leg
Right leg swings behind left as you land
Swing arms across body to help momentum
Immediately jump back to right side
Focus on soft, controlled landings
Move side to side with skating motion

modifications.easier: Step side to side (no jump), reduce distance, slower pace
modifications.harder: Increase jump distance, faster pace, add light touch down with hand

conditions.knee: Lateral forces on knee - high risk
conditions.balance: Requires good balance - modify if needed
